Rector-reeze.text-2: I sincerely congratulate you on joining the Impuls Medical Institute family! Today, you are embarking on an important and responsible path â€” the path of medicine, which is not only about knowledge but also about humanity, patience, and the noble values of helping others.
Rector-reeze.text-3: At our institute, all conditions are created for you to receive high-quality education, and with the help of a team of qualified professors equipped with modern technologies and scientific achievements, you have the opportunity to deeply explore knowledge. The education you receive here will not only enhance your professional experience but also lay a strong foundation for helping people as a future doctor.
Rector-reeze.text-4: Our goal is to develop each of your potentials to the highest level and to equip you with the necessary skills to become leaders in the medical field in the future. This path is not easy, but your diligence, patience, and thirst for knowledge will lead you to success.
Rector-reeze.text-5: During your studies at our institute, you will not only acquire knowledge and skills in your specialty but also make friends, understand the importance of teamwork, and learn to provide assistance. Each of your successes is our success. I wish you great achievements, scientific discoveries, and the realization of your dreams in the new academic year. Join our institute and be ready to accomplish great things!

About-us.text-1: Impuls Medical Institute is a leading private higher education institution in the field of medicine, offering modern education and scientific research. Our primary goal is to train highly qualified personnel in healthcare, provide medical education based on modern technologies, and conduct scientific research.
About-us.text-2: Our History Impuls Medical Institute began its operations in 2022 as the first private medical institute in Namangan region. It was established to address the urgent issue of the shortage of personnel in the medical field. The institute operates under license number 047559 issued by the State Inspectorate for Supervision of Education Quality under the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
About-us.text-3: Our Educational Process The educational process at our institute is based on a credit-module system, with classes organized in a hybrid format. Our hybrid education system means that students gain practical training offline with leading professors from Uzbekistan and around the world, while also using an integrated system of educational platforms, video lectures, and case studies to support independent learning.
About-us.text-4: Research and Innovations Our institute places great emphasis on scientific research. Our research focuses on current issues in healthcare and improving the effectiveness of medical education. We collaborate with foreign scientific centers and institutions to organize our research according to international standards and offer practical solutions to the field of medicine.
About-us.text-5: Our Values Transparency: We prioritize openness and integrity in all our processes, establishing trustworthy and transparent relationships with students, staff, and partners.
About-us.text-6: Accountability: We strive to responsibly fulfill the tasks entrusted to us, ensuring honesty and reliability in everything we do.
About-us.text-7: Adaptability: We quickly adapt to changing modern requirements, embracing innovations and being open to new opportunities.
About-us.text-8: Development: We support continuous growth and improvement, constantly striving to develop new knowledge and skills for our students and team.

Institut-history.text-1: History of Impuls Medical Institute's Opening
Institut-history.text-2: In 2018, Impulse Multidisciplinary Private Clinic was established in Norin district of Namangan region to provide quality and modern medical assistance to patients. However, the early days of the clinic coincided with the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic, which became a challenging test for the whole world. Despite helping many patients, the clinic couldn't assist everyone due to resource limitations.
Institut-history.text-3: During the pandemic, obtaining modern technologies, equipment, and medicines required significant funds. The biggest issue was the shortage of qualified doctors. The shortage of medical personnel was a major problem not only for our clinic but across Uzbekistan. Realizing this, we understood the need to take a step towards developing the medical field ourselves.
Institut-history.text-4: Thus, in 2019, the idea of opening our own medical institute to train qualified personnel in medicine was born. We studied advanced education systems abroad, including medical education and healthcare systems in Europe, Asia, and America, analyzing where the best medical training was provided and how high-quality assistance was delivered to patients.
Institut-history.text-5: Based on our research, we decided to open a medical institute that aligns with the USMLE system in the United States. We recruited qualified specialists and learned from them to achieve this goal.
Institut-history.text-6: Finally, in 2022, after several years of efforts, Impulse Medical Institute was opened as the first and only private medical institute in Namangan region under license number 047559 issued by the State Inspectorate for Supervision of Education Quality under the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan. Today, our institute is dedicated to preparing competent specialists in the medical field, based on a modern medical education system.

Scientific-council.text-1: The Scientific Council of the Impuls Medical Institute is the main collective body that addresses issues related to the institute's scientific activities. The Scientific Council operates in accordance with the Law of the Republic of Uzbekistan 'On Education' No. 637 dated September 23, 2020, the Labor Code of the Republic of Uzbekistan No. 161-I, the Law of the Republic of Uzbekistan dated December 21, 1995, the Law 'On Science and Scientific Activities' No. 576 dated October 29, 2019, and other local regulatory legal documents, as well as the institute's Charter. The council also functions based on the institute's 'Regulation on the Scientific Council' and acts as an authorized body within the framework of the established legal documents.
Scientific-council.text-2: The main goal of the Scientific Council is to make collective decisions on all issues based on scientific activities at the institute and to promote scientific research.
Scientific-council.text-3: The activities of the Scientific Council are based on the principles of transparency, collective discussion, and problem-solving, requiring a responsible approach before the institute's staff and students.
Scientific-council.text-4: The main tasks of the Scientific Council:
Scientific-council.text-5: Defining the main directions of the institute's scientific development; Legally and normatively regulating the main issues of organizing scientific activities; Developing and implementing scientific activity programs of the institute; Reviewing and deciding on issues of research and analytical activities; Approving the plan of scientific research topics carried out by the institute; Approving the work plans of the Institute's Scientific Council;
Scientific-council.text-6: The Scientific Council of the Impuls Medical Institute plays an important role in further developing the institute's scientific and research activities, aiming to achieve high scientific standards.

administration-institute.text-1: Department of Scientific Research and Innovations
administration-institute.p-1: Manages scientific research and grant projects, enhances the qualifications of teachers and scientific staff, and works on improving the institute's ranking.
administration-institute.text-2: Department of Youth Affairs and Spiritual-Educational Work
administration-institute.p-2: Supports students and ensures their moral and ethical development, manages student dormitories and sports activities.
administration-institute.p-3: Organizes the educational process, monitors its quality, and coordinates cooperation with teachers.
administration-institute.text-4: Department of Educational Quality and Quality Control
administration-institute.p-4: Evaluates the quality of the educational process, the pedagogical skills of teachers, tests, and educational resources.
administration-institute.p-5: Develops international cooperation, attracts international students, and manages international grants.
administration-institute.p-6: Promotes the institute's products and services, conducts market research, and develops marketing strategies.
administration-institute.p-7: Plans the budget, manages financial records, and monitors expenses and revenues.
administration-institute.p-8: Purchases materials and resources for the institute, conducts inventory, and manages logistics processes.
administration-institute.p-9: Recruits staff, develops them, and manages payroll.
administration-institute.p-10: Monitors all legal activities of the institute and develops legal documents.
administration-institute.p-12: The responsibilities of the Student Union include: Protecting student interests: Identifying student problems and discussing them with the institute leadership. Organizing social and cultural events. Supporting clubs and organizations: Helping students establish and operate clubs and organizations of their interest. Promoting unity among students: Organizing activities aimed at increasing friendship and cooperation among students.
administration-institute.p-13: Coordinates and monitors the students' academic process, protects and stores their personal information, and ensures the provision of qualified administrative services. Provides services to students related to the educational process through the system. Provides information to students regarding the academic process and electronic platforms (HEMIS, Moodle, LMS). Coordinates students' dormitory and housing arrangements. Assists students in scientific and innovative activities. Provides advice to faculty members regarding systems. Organizes student admission, transfers, reinstatements, and expulsions. Maintains statistics on students and inputs them into the system. Provides information about class schedules and exams. Issues academic transcripts and certificates. Provides GPA (grade point average) certificates. Issues student certificates and housing documents. Monitors students' academic debts and works with them. Provides assistance to students with rental subsidies.
administration-institute.p-14: Manages information resources: Manages all information resources of the institute and ensures their efficient use. Manages library activities: Organizes and supervises the daily operations of the library. Provides assistance to students and teachers: Provides advice and support on information resources and library services. Prepares electronic educational materials: Prepares electronic learning materials and multimedia resources and monitors their quality.

faq.question_1: When does the institute's admission take place?
faq.answer_1: Once a year, from July to September.
faq.question_2: What documents are required for admission?
faq.answer_2: A passport or ID for registration for the exam, and a certificate of completion of 11th grade or a college diploma are required. Other documents will be submitted after passing the exam.
faq.answer_4: Yes, there are. The entrance exam includes 50 questions from Biology, Chemistry, Mathematics, and IQ subjects.
faq.question_5: When will the entrance exams take place?
faq.answer_5: The exam dates will be notified to applicants via SMS after submitting their documents.
faq.answer_6: Currently, only the General Medicine program is available.
faq.question_7: What opportunities are available for students who fail the entrance exams?
faq.answer_7: Applicants who do not score enough points in the entrance exams or internal exams can attend Prefoundation courses.
faq.question_8: In which language are the classes conducted?
faq.answer_8: For international students and those with a B1 level certificate in English, classes are conducted in English; for local students, classes are in Uzbek.
faq.question_9: Is there a dormitory for students?
faq.answer_9: Yes, we currently have a dormitory that can accommodate more than 230 students.
faq.answer_10: Students who achieve the best results during the semester and actively participate in community activities will receive a 100% grant for the semester, provided to the top 10% of students.
faq.question_11: How much is the contract fee?
faq.answer_11: For the 2024-2025 academic year, the contract fee for one semester is 16,500,000 UZS.
faq.question_12: Can the contract fee be paid in installments?
faq.answer_12: According to the institute's internal regulations, the annual contract fee can be paid in 4 installments under a contract.

qadriyatlarimiz.vision_p: To become a globally recognized leading medical education institution, integrating modern medical knowledge and practice with advanced technologies to contribute to improving the health of society.
qadriyatlarimiz.mission_p: To develop medicine and medical education, thereby increasing life expectancy. The Impuls Medical Institute, in its mission, upholds the highest values of humanity â€” health and the sanctity of life. It aims to integrate modern technologies into medical education and provide training based on international standards. It also aims to develop international cooperation and provide students with opportunities for education and internships abroad. This institution is dedicated to contributing to the extension of human life and the promotion of a high-quality, fulfilling life through the development of medicine and medical education.

docs.text-1: Based on the license No. 047559 issued on November 9, 2022, by the State Inspection for Control of Education Quality under the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan, Impuls BSR LLC is authorized to provide non-state educational services.
docs.text-2: Impuls BSR LLC, based on license No. 047559, started its activities on November 9, 2022. The Impuls Medical Institute offers a 6-year Bachelor's degree program in the field of General Medicine (60910200), and graduates are awarded a Bachelorâ€™s degree in General Medical Practice.
docs.text-3: Currently, the institute has 6 departments, 110 professors and lecturers, and more than 50 clinical practice bases operating under contract.

xalqaro-xamkorlik.text: Impuls Medical Institute pays great attention to international cooperation. Our institute operates in order to establish and develop long-term cooperative relations with leading universities, scientific research centers and medical institutions from different countries. Within the framework of cooperation, scientific research, training programs, exchange of experience of students and professors are organized. We strive to ensure the quality of education in accordance with international standards, encouraging the global exchange of knowledge and innovation.

grand.text-1: Attention opportunity: 100% grants for students achieving high results:
grand.text-2: To provide even stronger motivation for the students of Impuls Medical Institute every semester, the founders of the institute offer 100% grants to 10% of the students.
grand.text-3: These grants are determined at the end of each semester, and the winning students are awarded the full grant by the institute. Take advantage of this opportunity and step forward with your academic and practical achievements!
grand.text-4: The procedure for conducting the grant exams and calculating grant results: Every semester, the 10% of students with the highest grant points are awarded a 100% grant for the next semester.
grand.text-7: Being a member of one or more clubs organized by the Student Union and actively participating in these clubs;
grand.text-8: Participating in the Teacher Assistant project;
grand.text-9: Regularly engaging in any sport (mini-football, table tennis, chess, checkers, basketball, volleyball, swimming, wrestling, boxing, etc.)
grand.text-10: Note: If one of the four conditions listed above is not met, the student will not be recommended for a grant.
grand.text-11: The procedure for calculating grant points:
grand.text-12: The average score of final exams in specialized subjects on the first attempt is 40%.
grand.text-13: The average score of final exams conducted by the examiners in specialized subjects (independent work grades are not counted) on the first attempt is 20%.
grand.text-14: Grant exam result on the second attempt is 40%.
grand.text-15: Total grant points: Final control (40%) + Intermediate control (20%) + Grant exam (40%) = 100%.
grand.text-16: If a student cannot attend the first attempt exam due to a valid reason, a document confirming the reason for absence on the exam day must be submitted, and if this document is deemed valid by the Education Quality Department, the student's second or third attempt scores will be multiplied by a percentage. The second attempt score will contribute 75% to the grant score, and the third attempt score will contribute 60%. If a student cannot attend the first attempt and cannot provide a valid reason, no points will be awarded for that exam when calculating the grant score.
grand.text-17: The grant exam is a separate exam held at the end of the semester. Students will take a test consisting of one (1st-year students) or multiple blocks (higher-year students) with 40 questions in each block. The tests will include basic questions and situational problems in the specialized subjects. A certain portion of the questions in each block (the same number for the whole course) will be in English. One hour is allocated for each block.

student-union.text-2: The responsibilities of the Student Union include the following:
student-union.text-3: Protecting the interests of students: Identifying students' problems and discussing them with the Institute's leadership.
student-union.text-4: 1. Organizing social and cultural events: Organizing various events, entertainment, and cultural activities for students.
student-union.text-5: 2. Providing resources: Offering resources and services to support students in their studies, psychological assistance, and career development.
student-union.text-6: 3. Supporting clubs and organizations: Helping students organize and operate clubs and organizations of their interest.
student-union.text-7: 4. Promoting unity among students: Conducting activities aimed at increasing friendship and collaboration among students.
student-union.text-8: Clubs and circles planned to be established at Impuls Medical Institute:
